pr_title: [onewire] Fix error handling for connection issues (#7149)

timeline.message:
binding does not recover from dead and restarted owserver #7149
but when server goes down, something explodes...

Signed-off-by: Alexander Behring <alex@behrings.eu>

Fixes for Onewire binding issue 7149.
* Unsynchronized access to OwserverConnection.java
* Bridge erroneously allows refreshes although connection is in state FAILED
* OwserverBridgeHandler.refresh does not abort refresh in all places when the connection state goes to FAILED.
* OwserverConnection.checkPresence() needs a throws declaration.
* The new CLOSED state in OwserverConnection.close was set after error handling - overwriting a potential FAILED state set by try-catch block.
* Error handling of output stream unavailability in OwserverConnection.write was inconsistent with handling other issues. An OwException needs to be thrown.
* Error handling in OwserverConnection.read has too broad of a try-block

In addition, some code documentation and some more tracing output which might be generally helpful.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Behring <alex@behrings.eu>

replies.bodyText:
Thanks - I do take your point that during intialization there shouldn't be any parallel threads accessing the object. However just from the signatures of the methods, a parallel call to one of the reads / writes would be possible. Furthermore, the owserverConnection could also be an already existing object.
So my suggestion would be to play it safe...
